alert.note: Alert for Pima (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 19 at 5:43PM MST until August 19 at 6:30PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Central Arizona, including the following county, Pima. * WHEN...Until 745 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 539 PM MST, Doppler radar thunderstorms with heavy rainfall moving into extreme northwest Pima county. These storms have had a history of producing very heavy rainfall, and will likely impact Ajo and Highway 85 to the north of Why. Expect rainfall runoff to rapidly drain into normally dry washes, roadway dips and other low-lying areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ajo and Why. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
